task_summary: Detect the fridge handle, grasp it, pull to open the hinged door, verify open, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 manipulator opens a small white refrigerator with a hinged door. The scene includes a fridge next to drawers and the robotâ€™s gripper approaching the handle. The behavior first ensures the handle is perceived, then aligns the end-effector, prepares a grasp pose, grasps the handle, and executes an opening motion via a high-level container action. The door state is verified after pulling, and the arm retreats to a safe distance. Timing bins and tolerances are conservative to reduce collisions in the tight office-like setting.
preconditions: Robot is powered and within reach of the fridge
No obstacles block the handle trajectory
Gripper is functional and can close on the handle
stepwise_plan: Perceive or scan to localize the fridge handle
Approach and align to the handle with tight tolerance
Open gripper and compute a pull-oriented grasp
Pick the handle using the computed grasp
Open the fridge door (hinged) using a pull
Verify the door is open and retreat
success_criteria: Fridge door angle visibly increases and remains open
Arm retreats to a safe standoff without collisions
failure_and_recovery: If handle not visible, raster scan and re-detect
If grasp fails, recompute grasp and retry pick
If door resists, re-align and repeat opening motion
task_long_description.termination: Terminate once the door is reported open and the robot has retreated to a safe position.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the handle is currently visible.
Active scan to localize the handle.
Detect the handle once in view.
Move and align the TCP to the handle.
Compute a pull-oriented grasp on the handle.
Verify that a grasp pose was produced.
Open the fridge door by pulling after grasp.
Back off from the open door.

failure_modes: Handle not detected due to occlusion or glare
Collision with adjacent drawers or door edge
recovery_strategy: Rescan with raster pattern and re-detect
Re-approach with tight tolerance and recompute grasp
Abort and retreat if contact forces spike unexpectedly
assumptions: Fridge uses a standard hinged door; handle is graspable.
OpenContainer abstracts the pull motion once the handle is grasped.
Robot is already near the fridge; no long-range navigation required.

expected_success_criteria: Door appears open in subsequent frames
